then type like ::giveitem player_name_here 4151

item.source: Runesource: giveitem command not giving other player items?

item.title: Runesource: giveitem command not giving other player items?
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

I don’t know what ‘fullString’ refers to, but I have a feeling it’s wrong. I suggest you to improve your command handling system (a link to a simple one) and to perhaps actually learn the language.

I would find another way to get the player, but in-line with your current idea:

[code=java]// Gives an item to the given player
// Syntax: giveitem player-name item-id [item-amount]
else if (keyword.equalsIgnoreCase(“giveitem”)) {
// Default parameters
String name = args[0];
int itemId = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
int itemAmt = 1;

// Getting the item amount, if it's available
if (args.length == 3) {
    itemAmt = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
}

// Looping through the player array
// pretty inefficient, you should find a work-around!
for (Player p : World.getPlayers()) {
    // Checking if the current player is null
    if (p == null) {
        continue;
    }
    
    // Comparing names
    if (p.getUsername().equalsIgnoreCase(name)) {
        // Adding the item
        p.getInventory().addItem(new Item(itemId, itemAmt));
        
        // Sending the success message
        getActionSender().sendMessage("whatever");
        
        // Returning to prevent further looping
        return;
    }
}

}[/code]

Note: I might have missed something, i’m pretty tired.

Read full topic
item.source: Runesource: giveitem command not giving other player items?

item.title: Runesource: giveitem command not giving other player items?
item.dc:creator: @sorecheeny sorecheeny
item.description:
@sorecheeny wrote:

else if (keyword.equalsIgnoreCase("giveitem")) { String name = fullString; int id = Integer.parseInt(args[0]); int amount = 1; getActionSender().sendMessage("You give a(n) " + new Item(id).getDefinition().getName().toLowerCase() + " (" + id + ")."); for (Player player : World.getPlayers()) { if (player == null) continue; if (player.getUsername().equalsIgnoreCase(name)) { inventory.addItem(new Item(id, amount)); return; } } }

This is a give item command, ::giveitem (item id) (amount) (player name)

How do I fix it, it says the actionSender part, but the other player doesn’t get the item

Read full topic
